<title level="1" right="Action">[Quick Alchemy](/Actions.aspx?ID=2) <actions string="Single Action" /></title>

<traits>
<trait label="Alchemist" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=7" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 72 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Cost** 1 batch of infused reagents

**Requirements** You have the formula for the alchemical item you're creating, and you're either holding or wearing [alchemist's tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2).

</column>

---

You swiftly mix up a short-lived alchemical item to use at a moment's notice. You create a single [alchemical consumable item](/equipment/alchemical-items) of your advanced alchemy level or lower that's in your formula book without having to spend the normal monetary cost in alchemical reagents or needing to attempt a [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) check. This item has the [infused](/Traits.aspx?ID=94) trait, but it remains potent only until the start of your next turn.
